releases.name: Version 0.9.3 (Beta)
releases.body: * fixed color scoping for dashboards

releases.name: Version 0.9.2 (Beta)
releases.body:
* added Porsche 991 GT3 Cup car
* added Porsche 991 GT3 Dashboard
* disabled Shift Lights while not in car

releases.name: Version 0.9.1 (Beta)
releases.body: Added Audi 90 GTO and Nissan GTP ZX-T cars.

releases.name: Version 0.9.0 (Beta)
releases.body: Software has been re-branded from `irdash` to _Fermio Motorsport Display_.

releases.name: Version 0.8.3 (Beta)
releases.body:
# Bug Fixes
- fixed delta display (+/-) in Mercedes AMG GT3 dashboard
- fixed missing revs in Mercedes AMG GT3 dashboard

releases.name: Version 0.8.2 (Beta)
releases.body: - fixed an issue with the left-padding of formatted lap-times on all dashboards.

releases.name: Version 0.8.1 (Beta)
releases.body:
- fixed an error with dashboard auto loading w/o car profiles.
- smaller bug fixes and correction with updated dependencies.

releases.name: Version 0.8.0 (Beta)
releases.body:
# Remote

Dashboards can now be used on remote devices (it works, but its not tested that much). The Dashboards run on port `9185`. Simply grab the IP address of your computer and open it in your mobile browser: `http://<ipaddress>:9185/`

# Dashboards

Dashboards have been re-implement with ReactJS. Rendering should be faster/smoother (and mobile device compatible) -- performance impact on older computers less significant.

# Settings

Setting GUI and configuration of the Dashboards in general have been refactored.
- "Profiles" has been renamed to "Car Profiles".
- "Shift Points" was renamed to "Gear Shifts" and is integrated into the "Car Profiles".
- "Window" was integrated into "Dashboards" (one configuration for each Dashboard).

# Shift Lights

Firmware now works with FastLED library and supports all chipsets. **Update your firmware!**

releases.name: Version 0.7.3 (Alpha)
releases.body:
# Shift Lights

Arduino connection is no longer reset between sessions.

# Debug

Debug flag is officially removed.

releases.name: Version 0.7.2 (Alpha)
releases.body:
# Watchers

Car watchers and session watchers are established for future functionality.

# Shift Lights

Added option to reverse the LEDs. Meaning, you can reverse the sequence of order to control the LEDs from right to left instead of left to right (default behavior). This should help NeoPixel mounted in reverse.

# iRacing

Fixed an issue with the session ticks, which may be reset if you join a race from practice, which may result in an unresponsive software.

releases.name: Version 0.7.1 (Alpha)
releases.body:
# Car Profiles

Car Profiles are no longer defined as a default profile. Instead, this setting has been moved ofter to Shift Lights. Additionally, Car Profiles can be associated with a Dashboard, automatically loading it if the car is changed.

# Shift Lights

Shift Light Profiles can now be defined as default profile, acting as a fallback for cars without an associated profile.

# Tray

Added a tray icon to access windows directly and close the dashboard application

# Miscellaneous

Added a donation and window minimization button.

releases.name: Version 0.7.0 (Alpha)
releases.body:
# Windows
- split windows into configuration and dashboards
- only open websocket on dashboard windows
- added config/close button to dashboards

releases.name: Version 0.6.1 (Alpha)
releases.body:
# Branding
- added ferm.io branding (logo, spinner, etc...)

# Dashboards
- added a button (`NE`) to go to settings page.
- fixed styling of Motec D153 dashboard.

# Configs
- improved config file watching performance.

# ShiftLights
- split profiles into separate files for performance.

# Migrations
- added missing `v060` migration with `kutu.json`.

releases.name: Version 0.6.0 (Alpha)
releases.body:
# Arduino Shift Lights

Added support for Arduino controlled Shift Light Indicators via Adafruit NeoPixels.

# Logging

A log file is written in case of an unexpected error. You can find the `error.log` in `%APPDATA%/irdash/error.log`.

releases.name: Version 0.5.0 (Alpha)
releases.body:
# GUI / Look&Feel

Updated the configuration GUI / look & feel. Shall be optimized for touch screens.
_Touch screen support will be established soon._

# Motec D153

Added a [Motec D153](http://www.motec.com/d153/d153overview/) dashboard.

# Dashboard Settings

Individual dashboard settings can now be applied. Dashboards with specific settings are:
- Mercedes AMG GT3 (Delta)
- Motec D153 (Mode, Delta)

# Arduino Shift Lights

Added a sneak peek of how the configuration for the Arduino Shift Lights will look like.

# Angular/ES6 Refactoring

Continued refactoring towards a cleaner architecture and ES6.

# Electron 1.0

Upgraded to Electron 1.0.

releases.name: Version 0.4.0 (Alpha)
releases.body:
# Squirrel Installer

Beside the release zips, a Squirrel based installer will be generated for each release starting with `v0.4.0`. If you use the installer, irdash will be installed into `%LocalAppData%\irdash` automatically. Configuration files still remaing in `%AppData%\irdash`.

# Custom Shift Points

You can now set custom shift points for each car (if one is missing, please let me know). Just select the car you want to adjust, enter the custom shift points and click save. The dashboards automatically make use of your custom shift points, even if you switch the car between sessions. If no custom shift points are added, the iRacing ingame telemetry data for each car is used (which may not be optimal).

# iRacing Configuration

You can now set the host and frames per second for the Kutu iRacing Browser application. This, at least, allows you to run the Dashboard on another computer and adjust it to not steal as much performance on less powerful machines (e.g. by lowering the fps). _This may be a step forward into releasing native iOS/Android apps in the near future._

# Arduino Shift Lights

Arduino SLI is in the making and will be integrated directly into irdash very soon.

# Angular/ES6 Refactoring

The whole app was refactored towards a better Angular compatible architecture and with ES6 in mind. This shall help to ensure faster development cycles and a future proof architecture.

releases.name: Version 0.3.0 (Alpha)
releases.body:
# Formula Renault 2.0 Dashboard

Added the Formula Renault 2.0 dashboard.

# Dashboards

Added ability to switch between dashboards (click on `Boards` in the config dialog `Ctrl+,`).

# Config

Window config shows current window `width/height` and `posX/posY` to support fine tuning. Saving settings applies them immediatly, e.g. resizing the window and positioning it accordingly.

There's also an option called `fixed` which will fix the window position, effectively disabling window moving/dragging. This setting should help to prevent accidental window movements after figuring out the exact `posX/posY`.

releases.name: Version 0.2.0 (Alpha)
releases.body:
# Config

Added a very basic config dialog (open it up by pressing `Ctrl+,)` set `width`, `height`, `posX`, `posY` and `debug` flag. The dashboard still needs to be restarted after changing on of these values.

# Responsive

Made the dashboard responsive, meaning it scales with the window width & height. It's still optimized for a `5:3` aspect ratio and `800x480` pixel but it uses the full window width & height now.

# Dashboard

Minor adjustments and improvements for the dashboard (look & feel, logic & algorithms).

# Angular

Prepared Angular to be able to show more than the dashboard (e.g. the config dialog). This is the ground work for multiple dashboards.

releases.name: Version 0.1.1 (Alpha)
releases.body: Changed the `debug` flag to `false` by default.

releases.name: Version 0.1.0 (Alpha)
releases.body:
First release of my iRacing Dashboard. **Highly experimental and no guarantee that it works.**

For more information, visit the [originating forum thread on Virtual Racing e.V. forums](http://forum.virtualracing.org/showthread.php/99803-DIY-%28iRacing%29-Dashboard-Software).
